posts.name: Spencer Greene / 1868
posts.cooked:
Hi - is anyone else seeing a problem with a fresh (empty) robot project, in the src/test/cpp/main.cpp file both <hal/HAL.h> and "gtest/gtest.h" are unresolved?

This is on MacOS, using the .dmg installer, WPILib 2022.1.1 Kickoff Release.

If so any clues how to resolve?  tia.

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: Does the code build?  These are likely just intellisense errors.

posts.name: Spencer Greene / 1868
posts.cooked: The robot code builds.  I suspect though that unit tests won’t work.  ?

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked:
Run the WPILib command palette “test robot code” command to run the tests.  I’m not sure if you’ve seen the documentation on unit testing?

Unit testing is a method of testing code by dividing the code into the smallest “units” possible and testing each unit. In robot code, this can mean testing the code for each subsystem individually...

link_counts.title: Unit Testing — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: Spencer Greene / 1868
posts.cooked:
Ah never mind - it does appear to be an IDE issue not a code issue.

Commenting out either of those includes causes the test build to fail - but the test build completes and runs when they are included. So they are properly resolved in the build, it’s just that the IDE doesn’t know that.  My bad - thanks.

posts.name: Thad House
posts.cooked: Intellisense being broke is actually correct. The Intellisense engine doesn’t know if you are building for desktop or building for the roborio when you open a file, so it defaults to roborio. To change Intellisense mode, on the status bar on the bottom there will be a “linuxathena” status icon. If you click that, a popup will appear allowing you to set a different mode. Chose one of the osx ones to switch to desktop mode. To switch back, the status icon will have been replace with whichever mode you selected. Click it again and go back to linuxathena.

posts.name: Spencer Greene / 1868
posts.cooked: Aha!  That makes so much sense.  Thanks for the edification.
